edibble 0.1.2.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Function reference

Constructing an experiment

These are the main functions used to set experiments from scratch.

design() redesign()
Start the edibble design
set_units()
Set units used in experiment
set_trts()
Set the treatment variables
allot_trts() allot_units() allot_table()
Define the possible allocation of treatments to units
assign_trts() assign_units()
Assign treatments or units to units
serve_table()
Serve edibble table
nested_in()
Specify the nesting structure for units
crossed_by()
Specify the units to cross to index a new unit

Understanding your design

Function helpers to understand your design better.

plot(<edbl_design>) plot(<edbl_table>) plot_fct_graph() plot_lvl_graph()
Interactive plot of the edibble design
examine_recipe()
Check the recipe code
anatomy()
Anatomy of the design

Named experimental designs

The recipe of a named experimental design is displayed using the menu_* functions. The takeout() allows you to get the design table from selected menu.

menu_bibd()
Balance incomplete block design
menu_crd()
Completely randomised design
menu_factorial()
Prepare a factorial design
menu_graeco()
Graeco-Latin Square Design
menu_hyper_graeco()
Hyper-Graeco-Latin Square Design
menu_lsd()
Prepare classical Latin square design
menu_rcbd()
Prepare a randomised complete block design
menu_split()
Split-unit design
menu_strip()
Strip-unit design
menu_youden()
Youden square design
scan_menu()
Find the short names of the named designs
takeout()
Create a named experimental design

Latin-related designs

Helper functions for creating orthogonal array structures.

latin_square() latin_rectangle() latin_array()
Latin square designs and its generalisations as an array

Exporting the experimental design

These help to create data validation rules and export the experimental layout as xlsx file.

set_rcrds() set_rcrds_of()
Set records for given unit
expect_rcrds()
Set the expected values for recording variables
to_be_numeric() to_be_integer() to_be_date() to_be_time() to_be_character() to_be_factor()
Expected type of data entry
with_value()
Validation values
export_design()
Export the design to xlsx

Experiment from existing data

These are functions relevant when making an experiment from existing data

new_edibble() as_edibble() edibble()
An edibble table constructor

Experiments

These are some example experiments.

lady_tasting_tea
Lady tasting tea
skittles
Skittles experiment

Table manipulators

These functions manipulate or wrangle the edibble table into another form.

pivot_trts_widelist() pivot_trts_widetable()
Pivot treatments to a wider list or table format
as.data.frame(<edbl_table>)
Convert edibble table to normal data frame

Utility functions

These are mostly for internal usage and for those who wish to extend edibble functions.

cook_design()
Cook the design in the kitchen
Kitchen
A manipulator for the edbl_design.
nesting_structure()
Get the nesting structure for the units
is_edibble_design() is_named_design() is_edibble_table() is_edibble_graph() is_edibble() is_edibble_levels() is_nest_levels() is_cross_levels() edbl_design() edbl_table()
Test and get edibble objects
fct_nodes() fct_edges() lvl_nodes() lvl_edges()
Get the node or edge data from an edibble design
fct_attrs()
Setting the traits of factors
lvl_attrs()
Setting the traits of the levels
edibble-package _PACKAGE
edibble: Designing Comparative Experiments
new_edibble() as_edibble() edibble()
An edibble table constructor
print(<edbl_design>)
Print intermediate experimental design to terminal
record_step()
Record the coding step
as.character(<edbl_fct>) as.integer(<edbl_fct>) is_edibble_var() is_edibble_unit() is_edibble_trt() is_edibble_rcrd()
Utility functions for edibble variable
is_takeout()
A function to check if the output is a takeout design
select_units()
Select a subset of units from a cooked design
as_data_frame()
Convert an edibble data frame to normal data frame
